text: Plague Cultists
Their job is to spread plague; they may look like ordinary people, but their bodies are no longer human.
Marauders of Nurgle (Throwing Axes)
Death Guard
They are beyond the Chosen of Nurgle and act as the gardeners of Nurgle's garden, emitting a stench potent enough to rot everything.
Plague Spreaders
Mounted for faster plague spreading and quicker escape from towns.
Chaos Knights (Great Axes)
Chaos Knights wielding poison-coated great axes capable of rotting anything they touch, including armor and bones.
Death Reapers
Loyal followers of Nurgle, wielding scythes as symbols of their role as the Father’s emissaries, leaving a trail of skeletons.
Armored Plague Toads of Nurgle
More powerful toads, usually not leaving Nurgle’s garden, often collecting and decorating themselves with discarded parts from the garden.
Centigors of Nurgle (Throwing Axes)
Centigors throwing poison-tipped axes; they lack heavy armor but are faster moving.
Centigors of Nurgle (Great Axes)
Centigors wielding heavy weapons, crushing all enemies in sight. Blessed by the Plague Father with strong life and heavier armor.
Plague Ogres (Nurgling Cannon)
Plague Ogres using a once-great cannon, now firing Nurgle's essence that has parasitized them.
Plague Marauders throw axes to smash enemy armor, making it simpler and quicker.
